comments.html:
Yeah, I could use another layer of dictionaries (and it would definitely be a cleaner data model), but that seemed cumbersome to work with (from the operator perspective) at the time.

As for OSPFv3 data types - there's only so many ways to solve a given problem in a semi-sane way, so most of the solutions will have at least a partial overlap ;)
comments.name: Ivan Pepelnjak

comments.html:
Is it possible that your "setup.sh" script doesn't work? Because there isn't a "ansible.cfg" file in "Data-Models" folder.
Too bad that you used "if node != 'prefix'" in the templates. It looks cumbersome to me. I don't understand why you didn't use the nodes dictionary.
Your "Network_Prefix/network.yml" data model reminds me of OSPFv3 with LSA type 1,2,8,9. But I don't think it was your intent to reinvent OSPFv3 LSA types, wasn't it?
comments.name: Anonymous

comments.html: The underlying problem with your "setup.sh" script lies in your ".gitignore" file.
comments.name: Anonymous

comments.html: next step is to move that data into IPAM, so that each /31 is based on IPAM request :)
comments.name: Victor Zakharyev
